revised_title: A Comprehensive Guide to the Archives and Manuscripts of the Royal Society
tldr: This article provides a comprehensive guide to the archives and manuscripts in the possession of the Royal Society, detailing their arrangement, cataloging, and contents. It covers the minutes of meetings, committee records, correspondence, and scientific papers, with a focus on materials from the 17th to 19th centuries. The guide aims to make the Society's archives more accessible to researchers and historians.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archival Studies
